instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2850: What is 820-2850? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP5V_S3: What is PP5V_S3? PP5V_S3 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S3 suspend to RAM state..
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.5V_S3: What is 5V_S3? 5V_S3 is an abbreviation of “PP5V_S3” which is a 5 volt power rail present in an S3 state. S3 (Suspend to RAM) is a state where the system saves its context to RAM, a faster but more power-consuming method than S4. The system shuts down most components except for RAM, which remains powered to retain the system state. PM_SLP_S4_L is required for this rail to be present. .
definitions.ALL_SYS_PWRGD: What is ALL_SYS_PWRGD? ALL_SYS_PWRGD is present when PP1V8_S3, PP5V_S3, PP1V2_S3, PP1V05_S0, PP5V_S0, PP3V3_S0, & PP1V5_S0 are present and working. If any of these rails is not working, ALL_SYS_PWRGD will be pulled down and the machine will not turn on. .
definitions.PPVCORE_S0_CPU: What is PPVCORE_S0_CPU? This is the primary power rail for the CPU that powers the CPU, known as CPU vcore. Without this, the machine will be braindead. .
definitions.PLT_RESET_L: What is PLT_RESET_L? PLT_RESET_L is platform reset, this signal keeps the system from POSTing. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .
definitions.C9560: What is C9560? Tantalum capacitor on 820-2850 logic board that often dies and causes intermittent power to framebuffer PP1V8R1V55_S0GPU_ISNS and PP1V8R1V55_S0GPU_ISNS_R rail, causing GPU kernel panics. Replace with non-tantalum if machine is having random black screen or kernel panics.
definitions.U6100: What is U6100? this is an SPI ROM chip that holds the BIOS which is necessary for the machine to POST or try and power on..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no <SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Hi, hope you guys are doing great.

<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on, green light on charger, no visible liquid damage. <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>,  <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL>,  <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL>  are prensent but  <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL>  is missing.  <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL>  pulses to about 2.5v for a fraction of a second.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no <SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
"<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> ...  prensent but  <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL>  is missing"
Can you clarify your post???

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no <SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL>
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no <SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
If <SIGNAL>5V_S3</SIGNAL> pulses, then check for pulse at other coils.
Try starting in SMC bypass mode also.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no <SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
All coils pulse except for <CAPACITOR>C1689</CAPACITOR> and <CAPACITOR>C1690</CAPACITOR>. 

With SMC bypass the fans only spin for a sec.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no <SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
These caps are associated with <SIGNAL>1V05_S0</SIGNAL>, which comes from one of the coils you've said pulsing!
Maybe not all pulsing; what about VCORE?
Can you catch a pulse at <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no <SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Sorry, i meant L7030, not those caps. L7030 not pulsing. 

<SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> pulsing.

<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0GPU</SIGNAL> pulsing.

<SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> pulsing.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no <SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
L7030 should have stable voltage, no pulse of course.

Change <CAPACITOR>C9560</CAPACITOR>, just in case.

Any pulse at <SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no <SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Replaced <CAPACITOR>C9560</CAPACITOR>, still nothing.

No pulse at  <SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no <SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
So PCH doesn't know if power on sequence is acomplished.
Check for pulse at <SIGNAL>CPU_PWRGD</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>PM_MEM_PWRGD</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>CPUVTTS0_PGOOD</SIGNAL>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no <SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL>
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no <SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL>
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no <SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
RIP...

Thank you so much. Have a good day.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no <SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL>
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no <SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL>
threads.message: Replaced <CHIP>U6100</CHIP> with known working from another board of the same model but still no fan spin. Thank you very much for all of your help.
